summary: Completed comprehensive testing of MOT platform. Frontend works excellently with professional design and full navigation. Critical backend bug found affecting new user data access due to MongoDB ObjectId serialization issues.

critical_bugs.endpoint: Multiple GET endpoints (KPIs, Bonus, Forecast, Competências, DRE, Extrato)
critical_bugs.issue: HTTP 520 Internal Server Error for newly registered users due to MongoDB ObjectId serialization
critical_bugs.impact: New users cannot access their data - complete functionality breakdown
critical_bugs.error_details: ValueError: TypeError('ObjectId' object is not iterable) - MongoDB _id field not properly excluded from JSON serialization

working_endpoints.status: Working correctly for existing admin user
working_endpoints.note: Authentication and basic user operations function properly

ui_bugs.issue: Logout functionality not clearly visible in UI
ui_bugs.suggestion: Add visible logout button or user dropdown menu

accessibility_issues.issue: Missing aria-describedby attribute for dialog accessibility

design_feedback.feedback: Professional corporate design with excellent layout, proper spacing, and good color scheme
Sidebar navigation works perfectly across all pages with proper responsive behavior
KPI cards, traffic lights, radar charts, and progress bars implemented well

passed_tests: Dashboard KPI display with traffic light system
Bonus system interface and admin editing
Admin panel user management and KPI editing
Navigation between all 8 pages (Dashboard, Bonificação, Carreira, Extrato, DRE, Forecast, Competências, Admin)
Form validation and data input handling
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue in backend. All GET endpoints for newly registered users return 520 errors. The issue is in document creation/retrieval where MongoDB _id fields are not properly excluded from JSON responses. This prevents new users from accessing any of their data (KPIs, bonus, forecast, etc.). Existing admin user works fine, suggesting the issue occurs during new document creation.

success_percentage.backend: 45% - Core auth works, but data access fails for new users
success_percentage.frontend: 95% - Excellent UI/UX with minor logout visibility issue
success_percentage.integration: 70% - Works for existing users, fails for new users due to backend bug
